snippet.title: Pokemon - Ash's Room in Unreal Engine 4
snippet.description:
Now enjoy the VR Experience! https://gumroad.com/l/RExH

In honor of the 20th year anniversary of Pokémon I decided to recreate Ash’s room in Unreal Engine 4. Watching the Sun and Moon announcement trailer really inspired me to finish this project. I owned every single one of the Gameboys that they showed in the trailer and the main reason was to play Pokémon. 

There are a few things that are not in the original but I added in to pay homage. It turned out being almost a blend of multiple points in time in the series. Ash wore Red's style hat at a later point in the series so I use it instead. Good tribute to both. I tend to lean on a very detailed (sometimes over detailed) and mechanical style of things but in this case I stayed with a style that is similar to the show. Very simple textures with good lighting. I also went ahead and designed a user interface of what I imagined Pokedex software would look like on a pc.

I hope you all enjoy :D

Details:
Engine: Unreal Engine 4
Time taken: About 4 days after work.
All post and editing was done inside the engine, No external post.
I rendered from the viewport with Director Tools for UE4. http://director-tools.com/ 

Credits:
The song is a Pokemon Red and Blue orchestral. You can find it here: http://youtu.be/hlqvdpDiCzc

Poster: http://camtoonist.deviantart.com/art/Ash-s-Starter-Poster-548915484

If you are interested in seeing more of my work, I post regularly on twitter. Most of work consists of mechs, robots, drones, scifi and 3d printing. https://twitter.com/jarlanperez
